website_summaries.verdict: If document protection is a priority, this is definitely a model to consider. Waterproof and fire-resistant, with a strong key lock system and heavy metal construction.
pros: Very roomy, holds hanging files and other documents
Heavy duty construction, not easily removed by criminals
cons: Original keys are not durable, so duplicates recommended
Plastic elements not as fireproof as promoted
Better for document storage than valuable possessions

website_summaries.verdict: A good choice if it's practical for your needs – while it's a must-have for consumers who have numerous files to protect, its weight and design make it awkward to maneuver.
pros: Ideal for files and folders – spacious interior with lid compartment for CDs, DVDs and other small items
Rated to protect against 1550°F for up to 30 min
cons: Heavy, and difficult to move – almost 40 pounds empty, and has no handles
The keys are flimsy, and some owners reported them breaking in half during use

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe Safe
customer_reviews.text: I had the same problem as other reviewers. The safe was not very safe. It crumbled after only a handful of uses. I contacted SentrySafe, but it's been a couple of weeks and I haven't received a reply.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Really??
customer_reviews.text: Brand new - right out of the box - lid was totally ripped off the body of the safe.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke, spilled cement everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: Just like the other reviewers, I opened the box and lifted the handle to open the safe, and the handle came off, along with a ton of cement and cement dust which I inhaled and spent all morning cleaning off the floor of my office. I called Sentry, and the woman I spoke to did not apologize and told me to contact Amazon for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: It arrived broken and covered in dust.
customer_reviews.text: This may be a one time occurrence, but I received this safe in its original box in a box with no other padding. Which may have resulted in the safe arriving damaged. All of the plastic assembly was crushed or cracked. Dust, I assume part the the fire proofing, covered all surfaces of the safe. This maybe a good product, but I was not able to see its better assets. I returned the safe. I will try another at a later time.
customer_reviews.author: Charles G

customer_reviews.title: Quality issue, wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: Safe work well for awhile. No problems with lock and key but just the other day the handle ripped off the safe making the safe useless. I'm hopeful Amazon can refund me because I just bought the safe 2+ months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Welzbacher

customer_reviews.title: Keys made of butter. Make sure you make copies.
customer_reviews.text: The safe is good, but the keys are terrible. I just tried to open my safe and the key just melted apart, I didn't use much force. Now I have to figure out how to remove the other piece from the hole. Update: Removed key from the hole, when I got my second key I noticed it was bent. These keys are terrible and unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Nks

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Latch on the outside is entirely made of plastic. How good can a fireproof box be when the lid is held down entirely with a plastic latch that will melt quickly. I can see how other reviewers had theirs' break. Mine arrived with the lid popped out of the hinge which is just two interlocking shapes of foam filled outer plastic. It won't cleanly reassemble. Total waste of time especially for something so heavy and difficult to return.
customer_reviews.author: Ted J. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Not built to store sensitive items, photos, documents!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. This safe comes with a small warning label inside that explains its construction and fireproofing gives it a high internal humidity. It is not recommend for the storage of documents, jewelry with working parts, watches, photos, sensitive electronics, or anything else that can be damaged by high humidity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Plastic Casing Comes Off Without Any Pressure
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a very simple and practical safe except for the fact that the plastic came off the FOURTH time that I opened the safe. It is obviously very cheap quality. Unfortunately, I purchased the safe a little bit over two months ago so I can return it. I will contact the manufacturer to discuss the warranty and repair. Update: Contacted manufacturer several times but the line is either ever busy or disconnected. Shame on Amazon for hawking a very poor product with poor customer service.
customer_reviews.author: L.A

customer_reviews.title: LID BROKE COMPLETELY OFF!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had product 1 year after waiting 6 weeks to get it. Lid has completely broken off. And no way to even repair it. Back off safe has crumbled. Very badly made. Don't even bother with this. I'm now going to have to buy something else and spend more money. Just do yourself a favor and Buy something made of steel and not Chinese plastic. I have learned my lesson here. Gave 1 star because that's the lowest there is. I would sat more like minus 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Running Wolf

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier. I live on the lake
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier. I live on the lake, and it flooded the house a couple of weeks ago. Not one drop of water got in this. I had it on the floor downstairs and forgot to put it up. I bought it because of flooding and the chance of fire while not there. I have to say it works though. Third time that dang house flooded. Finally the county is doing something about it. Pro's. Very spacious Heavy but not heavy enough where I can not move it around. Easy to use. Did I say I found out it actually worked. Didn't want to find out but did. I would definitely buy one again, Wait I just did. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Dirt_Poor_PickerTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Decent safe; Plastic cracks above latch
customer_reviews.text: Good safe for the price, the only issue is that after using the latch about 10 times, the plastic above it has cracked. I've contacted SentrySafe and inquired about their warranty - if they make good on their product this will be a 4-5 star review.
customer_reviews.author: leila

customer_reviews.title: 2 broke within 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought one, and when I went to open it one day within a month of buying it, then entire plastic housing for the handle ripped right off exposing whatever the gypsum like material it's made out of. Amazon quickly replaced it at no cost, but 2 months later the plastic handle ripped right off again. It wasn't worth returning after that point, so if you need a heavy box to hold things, EXCELLENT! But if you want something Safe, not so excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little safe and sturdy, but vulnerable to intrusion and not secure.
customer_reviews.text: I liked how light the safe was and how it felt sturdy. The structure felt very solid. There’s also decent amount of room inside for possessions or files. This is not a very secure safe though it’s mainly designed to keep out nosy family members, Similar to an office sure I would not store any valuables worth stealing or anything in here that is irreplaceable. The lock and the latch both are very basic and feel cheap, They are mainly for show.
customer_reviews.author: Stella

customer_reviews.title: Cheap piece of junk that is not mechanically strongly built
customer_reviews.text: This is really a cheap piece of junk. I had the lid open and the next thing I know the lid had fallen backwards and pulled/broken completely off from the case body. Maybe thermally it will be insulated well in a fire, but mechanically it is not sound at all. Why bother to have a lock on the thing as if it were a safe when it could easily be pried open with a small crow bar from the back hinged side. Don't spend the money unless the only thing you want is protection from a fire, but that part I have not tested yet.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Like anything, a professional criminal will find a way to carry it off and open it. But, for the most part, if you hide it well in your house, especially a lower level where fire is less likely to strike, it's a great little safe. I bought one for myself, one for my grandson and one for my son. You can also use it inside a larger room safe, which is what we did. We store all of our birth certificates, dd1-14's etc in ours and put it inside the bigger safe.
customer_reviews.author: D. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great safe!
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews I was very worried what I was going to receive. I ordered two of these safes and after receiving them and looking at both of them and checking the locks and the latch in front both safes I think these safes are very well made and very great quality. They hold hanging folders well and the safe has a great tight seal. Yeah, the safes don't have handles but I've never seen one that did. Maybe the latch breaks because people use it as a handle when it's not. I found nothing wrong with both safes I purchased. I'm very glad I took the chance and ordered them. Very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Bill H

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed. Ordered what I thought was a quality safe ...
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. Ordered what I thought was a quality safe and it arrived damaged(see pictures) we have a really good UPS person so I know this is not from a shipping error. Seems like something too heavy was set on top or crushed it before it was even sent to us. Powdery substance was everywhere. I just ordered a replacement, because it is the perfect size, but this is my last try. Fingers crossed it doesn’t happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay P

customer_reviews.title: For the price, a great buy.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is HEAVY. I keep it tucked away in the closet out of the way. It's just big enough to hold my file folders and 8.5x11 inch papers, but nothing larger than that size would fit without folding. Seems secure enough for what I need it for, which is mainly peace of mind in the event of a fire or break-in. WIll it keep out a really dedicated thief? No. But it keeps things out of sight and presumably will save my most important documents in the event of a fire or water damage. And if it gets stolen it would slow them down in getting away with how heavy it is- an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Tobias

customer_reviews.title: the inside looks poor in quality
customer_reviews.text: Upon arrival, the inside looks poor in quality, irregular, like it might have a missing floor and has a few glue gun like stuff smeared around. Makes me question overall reliability of the product if it is well made.
customer_reviews.author: okokok

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: We bought this 2 years ago. We just kept it on my closet floor behind my clothes for wills and important documents. It had a total of 2 manilla folders in it. That's it. The first time we locked, unlocked it; the key broke off. The second key got bent, so (as there were no valuables in it) we just kept it unlocked. We are moving and took it out of the closet. We opened it for the first time in almost 2 years. The lid fell right off backwards! It turns out this was just a VERY heavy and expensive box. Such a waste.
customer_reviews.author: susan ruhlman

customer_reviews.title: Always read reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Hey it’s a sentry safe - great reputation, so why read reviews. Foolish me. When I opened the package I was appalled that the latching, locking system was plastic. Fire will easily melt it and then the box will be easy to open. Actually I bet I could open it with a couple of quick whacks with a mallet and screwdriver. Just received it today, wondering how long before I experience “breakage”. Guess I’ll need to decide if I’m going to keep it or return it. Oh, have to agree the key is cheap. Much like the keys used to lock a girls diary.
customer_reviews.author: Dyna309

customer_reviews.title: This is a good way to protect your papers and small items.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to protect documents and small items that I want to protect to some degree and can easily find when I need them. This thing is very heavy and looks like what-ever I put into it will be protected from water and some extreme heat damage. The UPS driver who delivered it (It's not wrapped so everyone can see what you ordered) said her mother has three of these. I can see why, as I'm considering getting a second one. I got the hanging folders to go with this but don't really need them as regular folders are working well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the worst made produces I’ve purchased. The original product was delivered broken, but Amazon replaced it. I’ve been using this for about a year and can’t see it being good for any use except a heavy expensive file box. The lid seal is always falling off, so I need to take care to make sure to put it back on correctly, not much good in a flood or fire if the seal isn’t attached correctly. It unlocks easily, but have trouble closing it so it can lock. Have to put a lot of pressure on a latch that feels like it made from cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: James Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Could use some upgrades.
customer_reviews.text: The safe arrived in excellent condition. The first thing I noticed was the lack of handholds. It would have been nice to mold in some handles on the side to make it easier to move around. The other item of note was the plastic latch that secures the top lid. I realize that it’s not a security safe but the plastic latch makes me question the ability to hold the lid down to prevent water from intruding.
customer_reviews.author: Makai

customer_reviews.title: Not pleased at all
customer_reviews.text: Returned the product the same day it arrived. The outside was damaged, there was white stuff all over it, and the icing on the cake is that the product materials that were INSIDE the safe were damp! Not pleased at all. The packaging wasn't damaged at all, so I am not quite sure how any of the above could have happened.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin H.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and price for a fire resistant safe.  Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: My manuscripts outgrew my first SentrySafe, so I purchased this identical safe for my ever-growing collection. It's a perfect size for 9 x12 tablets and hanging files, keeping everything clean, organized and safe from fire. Though it's quite heavy, I suppose a determined thief could make off with it somehow, or manage to break the plastic lock, so I wouldn't call it theft-proof. But if you're looking for a good quality, fire-resistant safe for important documents, I recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sue's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this thing just over 2 years ago and the hinges cracked and came apart like other reviewers have stated. There is a white cement-like powder all over the place. Threw it in the trash. Lousy quality!! I have some their older models and the have lasted for years. I have purchased 2-3 of these per year for about 20 years. (I give as gifts, promotions for our business, etc.) I'm sad to say I'll never purchase anything else from this company, as my attempts to contact them have gone on with no response. Terrible service and a terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J.Calderone

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line: If you use this safe, it will break.
customer_reviews.text: What a super-disappointing purchase. I've had the safe about two years, opening and closing the safe once or twice a month. The safe's rear outer plastic layer cracked the most recent time I opened the safe, spilling a yellow powder onto the floor. The lid of the safe literally fell off. The problem appears to be the heaviness of the lid. When opened, it places strain on the rear of the safe, causing it to crack. Design flaws happen; I get that, however, Sentry must have done zero product testing before releasing this product into the field. Either that, or they simply don't care.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbycarll

customer_reviews.title: Cheap,Fell apart. SentrySafe replaced it it.
customer_reviews.text: Update: it just got 2 more stars because I contact the sentry office and Jennifer D. was really helpful. Even though it's been 2 years since I got it, I sent some pictures to her and she replaced it. That is better than nothing! ============= 2 years after I bought this and after LITERALLY 3 all these 2 years, the lead fell apart, the corners opened and I could see the fire rated material inside. And that's what we bought to keep files safe?! Without even excessive use or someone to try to break it, just with normal use...it broke by it self. Amazon cannot refund and we are trying with the company now...we will see.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Very good safe, however...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good safe, holds everything I want to protect in the lid and is deep enough to hold my documents and whatever else I want to protect. However, one of the keys for the safe is bent and is basically useless (unless I find a way to straighten out) so I basically only have one key for now. Otherwise, safe is top notch!
customer_reviews.author: JMoose

customer_reviews.title: It works, until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this safe three years ago. About 4 months ago the lid broke off from safe at the hinge. I had to hammer it back on in order to close it again. This safe sits in my office closet, which is climate controlled and is never exposed to the elements. There is absolutely nothing I did that could have caused this other than opening and closing as designed. Therefore it has to be a design flaw and of course is no longer covered under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ybarra

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust this safe to protect your documents.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this safe in Sept. 2018. Upon receiving it, I thought it was pretty cheaply made, but I figured it would do fine protecting my documents. It sat on the floor in my closet and was opened less than a couple dozen times. The walls of the safe near the "hinges" began separate within a year. Today, the entire lid fell off. Sure, it was only $50, but I don't think it's worth $5. Do not buy this product. Sentry should be ashamed!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk - DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: The safe had dust all over it when I pulled it out of the box. The day I was trying to load it I noticed the side hinge plastic was already split. I literally walked away to get my phone to take pictures and by the time I walked back the lid completely broke off. The design is total garbage. It is some kind of plaster casing and the lid is attached by very small nubs that go into the plaster. But after literally no use, the plaster cracked and released to lid. Totally useless. Avoid this terrible product. Amazon should take this down.
customer_reviews.author: Chirs Johnson

customer_reviews.title: An utter joke, do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: First off when I opened the box the safe was dirty with what appeared to be drywall dust, clearly previously used. Second the keys were locked inside it so I had to have a locksmith open it for me which cost $50. Third after seeing it open and filthy inside as well, the locking mechanism just clasps into the plastic button/handle that opens the safe providing absolutely zero security. The plastic piece can more than easily be busted opened with a variety of tools or bashing objects. This thing is complete trash and a total waste of money. I'm afraid to see how fireproof and waterproof it actually is.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Roomy file storage box
customer_reviews.text: Has the runner slots for hanging file folders! Love it for storing my important documents. Very heavy and not easy to move. Also stores 2 backup hard drives along with a 2" thick document folder with ease. Locking mechanism is a bit rough, really have to click the lever down with some pressure to lock and same thing with the release. Comes with 2 keys.
customer_reviews.author: Integrity CC

customer_reviews.title: Hefty and tight.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had an emergency that warranted seeing if it is in fact fire and water safe, but as just a safe, it works for me! It is a good size for small items. I use it for important papers, passports and more. I will echo other sentiments that they key is VERY cheaply made. I also recommend getting a copy made from a sturdier base. Ours started bending on the first use. The safe is quite heavy, but not so heavy that it can't be removed from your house. Take that into consideration if theft is your biggest driver for buying this safe.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Heed the warnngs of previous customer photos depicting poor construction and subsequent damage
customer_reviews.text: If I could rate this Sentry safe with zero stars I would. Heed the warnngs of previous customer photos depicting poor construction and subsequent damage. This is the same damage I experienced upon delivery of my Sentry safe. The plastic casing is weak and much of the design relies on this thin plastic as structural support. The lid latch that doubles as the ‘security’ latch is a 0.25” thick piece of plastic. I would not classify this as a security safe. Unfortunately it appears that Sentry has lost all focus on QC. Returning immediately and looking for other options.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Marie Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing quality...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit disappointed in the unit. It's not really the quality I expect from SentrySafe, The unit locks with a pin rotating into a slot on the lid release/handle. Sadly, the handle is PLASTIC so it may as well not have a lock. The lock is in expensive, the locking pin [appears] to be tin, and the keys feel like they are going to snap when locking the unit, which requires careful alignment of the lid slot and locking pin. For a few more dollars these components could be upgraded. Otherwise, the unit is pretty solid and has plenty of room for [my] documents. The hanging file folder feature makes it easy to keep things orderly.
customer_reviews.author: Whillyw

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Great safe, great cost. Key is small could get lost if you’re not careful but comes with 2. Sturdy, hold a good amount. I bought it to use it to secure meds from my small children. Arrived swiftly and in good shape. Luck could be broken I’d really wanted to by adults but that wasn’t why I bought it. I was more worried for fire protection and to keep it little ones so it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality.
customer_reviews.text: The dimensions are exactly as stated. I just thought it was going to be smaller. It is big enough to put file folders in. The lock is easy to work and the safe is very heavy. It is an even better bargain for the price than I expected. I searched a number of other similar fireproof safes and this is an excellent product for the price. I have not had a fire yet, thank goodness. So, I can only assume it is fireproof. I bought it to put important documents and family photo DVDs in so they would be protected in case of a fire.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!—Our lid cracked off at just over 1 year old! : (
customer_reviews.text: Our safe literally fell apart (see pics) just over a year after purchasing it. All I did was open it and the lid fell off after the hinges cracked open. I contacted SentrySafe to ask if they make exceptions to their one year warranty and they said yes. I uploaded these same two pics via a live text chat, along with a screen shot of my Amazon receipt, and they happily agreed to FEDEX Ground me a new safe, without charge. So I'm very pleased with their customer service and that they stand by their products.
customer_reviews.author: H. Walker

customer_reviews.title: No Damages Upon Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned when I decided to purchase this item since I had read so many reviews stating their safe had arrived broken. Luckily mine arrived in perfect condition. It fit my needs and I had no issue using the hanging folders had purchased to place inside of it. It is rather heavy. So my only negative about the safe is that it does not have handles for me to grip when I need to pick it up and move it. So to be honest I just push it around if it need to be pulled. Otherwise it's great.
customer_reviews.author: MirGirl

customer_reviews.title: I did receive the replacement and am still happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had to reorder a replacement safe as the top completely broke off after a few weeks of ownership. WARNING; The safe is a bit top heavy...be very careful! The hassle was getting this back to UPS after ordering a replacement....this thing is HEAVY! I did receive the replacement and am still happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: steffi

customer_reviews.title: Wish I’d looked at the pix in other reviews
customer_reviews.text: It was damaged on arrival- DOA. I can’t even tell what the h*** happened. It’s got a big melted spot on the top. Maybe it would still work, but it looks like there’s asbestos inside, exposed by the melted spot. So... no. Within 5 minutes of opening the box, not even lifting it out, I processed a return/replacement, which is estimated to arrive on October 8. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it
customer_reviews.text: Yeah you'll be able to lock a substantial number of items away. But what's surprising and brings the entire product down, is the chintzy latch that secures the entire safe. A kick with some shoes on or a hammer will be more than enough to break that latch that locks the safe. It's made out of the cheapest possible plastic. Even worse than the plastic they use in McDonald's toys. You have to wonder what engineer signed off on this?
customer_reviews.author: Adam Wild

customer_reviews.title: I do want to mention that the weight is somewhat inconvenient.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this safe to protect my stuff from fire and water disaster. Hopefully it will do its job when something happens. I believe it has plastic/nylon housing with metal reinforcement inside. I do want to mention that the weight is somewhat inconvenient. Probably a result of sturdy construction to protect the contents from being crushed when something lands on it during a catastrophic fire. Too heavy to carry around conveniently but light enough for a man to run off with it. Sturdy enough to sit on but not sturdy enough for a sledge hammer or pry bar.
customer_reviews.author: Olivegold

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed with this safe
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this safe. It is heavy and seems to be sturdy, but the latch is made of plastic. I wonder how long it'll last before it breaks and I can't get in or can't lock it. It would cost too much to send it back, so I'll keep it without locking it.
customer_reviews.author: MUMM

customer_reviews.title: Sentry needs to improve their packaging. The top and ...
customer_reviews.text: Sentry needs to improve their packaging. The top and bottom latch bezels are cracked open in two places. White filler material leaking from bezel gaps. Considered returning the item, but after reading reviews of other people receiving items with much more severe damage decided to stick with the low level damage of mine. I will live with the damage by sealing the exterior cracks. Have purchased three prior Sentry products over the years and have had no issues. My last prior item, an earlier model, was purchased through Amazon and was received with no damage.
customer_reviews.author: DGL

customer_reviews.title: The lid breaks
customer_reviews.text: The lid is so heavy that it broke at the hinges and got my floor all messy with what looks like cement. I haven't owned this for more than 10 months and now I have to go buy another safe. Big disappointment and waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Bells

customer_reviews.title: you'll be happy with this
customer_reviews.text: This is a fire resistant container for hanging files, not a safe. If that's what you want, you'll be happy with this. If you want something that will withstand a crowbar, this is not what you want, the latch is plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Barwell

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT A SAFE!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I thought it was a safe... However it turns out it is nothing more than a waterproof firebox. The key is flimsy, and the latch is plastic. It is very easily broken into. If it had a metal handle and a sturdy luck, it would be a five star product. Not to mention My first safe came damaged, and the second came with one bent key. I kept it to safeguard my documents from fire etc. but this will not stop A thief, or an eight-year-old with a crowbar LOL
customer_reviews.author: Smalls*

customer_reviews.title: DUD
customer_reviews.text: This item came in the manufacturer's box with no packing to protect it. There was a flimsy plastic tray in the box -it's not obvious what it's function is. There was no booklet with any instructions on how to use the file. I cannot get the file to lock and every time it is opened and shut, there's flakes of some type of white stuff coming off of it. Unfortunately, it will have to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: NLDriver

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: The box was very old. Once we opened the box the safe did not have a key nor instructions. I’ve worked at a refurbishing company and I can tell when a product had been refurbished. This is an old safe which was beat up and severely scratched up. Not to mention there was a lot of white scuff marks on the safe. Highly dissatisfied!!
customer_reviews.author: Sony

customer_reviews.title: Leaks fireproof dust
customer_reviews.text: It is functioning at this time, but the latch is hard to close and can be locked open. My girlfriend has left it unlatched and locked open many times, which makes it not water or fireproof, due to the difficulty of latching the lid. That being said, when it locks the seal is extremely tight and I have no doubt it is waterproof. I have started to doubt the integrity of the fireproof lining since it continuously leaks a fine white powder from the seam around the latch every time it is moved.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not  worth the  money
customer_reviews.text: It started cracking after a few months .Too bulky and heavy . If you put a plastic folders the lid won't close .It should be a lil bit taller so it will take documents stored in hardcover folders.Also it will be nice to have handles or something to easy transportation. We moved and being that heavy with no handles it felt like a had a big ice cube..
customer_reviews.author: persuader

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart at the seams!
customer_reviews.text: The safe was awesome when we got it, but it's falling at apart have a year and a half. It sits in the corner of our closer, no direct sunlight, no extreme temperatures, no moisture, etc. and it has large gaping cracks at all of the seams and I'm afraid that they'll just get worse over time. If we actually want to protect our documents we'll have to get a new safe. Very disappointed and dissatisfied!
customer_reviews.author: KEPCRN

customer_reviews.title: Broke after minimal use
customer_reviews.text: This safe broke. I had it for two years and only opened a handful of times. I noticed the damage today while filing annual tax documents. It was never moved, frozen, hot, in water, or had any weight on it. I’m disappointed in the quality and assume it probably will not function as it is supposed to now.
customer_reviews.author: Shan

customer_reviews.title: Poor craftsmanship for a safe!
customer_reviews.text: The lock is plastic. One good tap and it's broken and you're in! This product does not qualify to be listed as a "safe". It's just a heavy folder at best. Don't waste your money. If you mistakenly drop or bang it, it will crumble to pieces.
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Item has broken latch upon arrival and opening box.
customer_reviews.text: I need to find out how to fix this order the product latch was not attached to the lid upon opening. I waiting on opening this box until I could have my husband lift it. Upon opening it we discovered the latch was not attached therefore we can not close the lid at all. Could we please get a response from you?
customer_reviews.author: Grace C. Beebe

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: If you are considering this for use with hanging folders, do not purchase. Even though there are ridges to accommodate hanging folders, there are protrusions in the lid placed so the lid will not close completely, therefore the lock is pointless. I write this after spending a Sunday afternoon organizing a large amount of documents into hanging folders only to discover this not insignificant problem, not to mention the fact that I'd spent almost 32 dollars on folders and tabs. This is more than half of the 55 dollars the "safe" cost. Not happy
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn Slack

customer_reviews.title: Sentry Home Safe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this home safe in 2019 and have been happy with it until recently. The safe has developed mildew along the back hinges. I have cleaned it up but am very disappointed in the safe now. It shouldn't have done this and I don't know now if it is safe to put my valuables in.
customer_reviews.author: Garden Lady

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice and heavy duty. It holds hanging file folders nicely too -this one was written shortly after receiving the product at the end of October 2017. Today, June 30th 2018, however is a different story... there is some white powdery substance that has begun leaking from the top of the box, I'm guessing it's what makes it "fire-safe"? It certainly doesn't look safe or environmentally friendly at all. I don't know what to do with this thing??? Check out the pictures, I feel the company should send me a call tag to pick this thing up and return my money.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Not Quality
customer_reviews.text: After having for 14 months the item was useless. I have left the top of the lid up for about 10-12 mins and came back to it snap off at the hinges. Other than that it seemed to be a fine safe. But I can only imagine it would not survive a fire if the lid cant hold its on weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lock broke, plastic casing cracked: do not buy this safe
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend purchasing this safe. Upon unboxing, I could immediately feel how cheap the lock was, when engaging the key into the tumblers there was lots of play and looseness. I was not surprised when after a few days of ownership the key snapped off in the lock under pressure of my fingers. I continued to use the safe even without the locking feature as my main intent is to protect from fire. Now, after 2 years of extremely infrequent opening and closing, a massive split in the outer plastic casing has formed along the hinge and top of box. At this point I now have a heavy box that doesn't lock nor protect from fire. Terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Piper

customer_reviews.title: Hope it's not asbestos?
customer_reviews.text: This product does seem to have a flimsy latch compared to earlier versions of a similar model number from 15 years ago (I have 3 of the earlier models). And there was a bit of white powder residue on this most recent product which concerned me when I opened the box to use it for the first time. Sentry may have some quality control issues.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Rubber gasket slipped out of place
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and strong, but was disappointed the a key rubber gasket slipped out of place after a few openings....I guess that I can re-glue it back in plane but looking at it I do wonder how such a rubber gaskets can be "fire proof:".
customer_reviews.author: Geopeople

customer_reviews.title: If the handle/lock breaks so easily, i don't know how it can withstand a ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, add me to the list . . . I've opened this about a dozen times, total, since i bought it and the handle and locking mechanism has broken. This is defect appears to be far from an aberration, and based on the other reviews, i would NOT buy this product. If the handle/lock breaks so easily, i don't know how it can withstand a fire. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: CMR

customer_reviews.title: Not Great
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had looked over this safe sooner so I could return it. The inside is caked in fire retardant powder and the waterproof seal is just lying inside of it. It's all fixable and cleanable, but I really don't want to deal with it. I understand SentrySafe is a good company but in general, this product will be a headache to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia B

customer_reviews.title: Cheap made...Not secure....but great for items of no monetary value
customer_reviews.text: Plastic....Really IT has a plastic lock that could easily be broken into. Not secure at all. I'm glad I just purchased this item to store papers of no monetary value. 2nd of all, It has a crack inside the safe on the bottom. I'm a Sr. Quality Specialist in my day job and this definitely wouldn't pass inspection where I work. I'm thinking these are made in China where they don't inspect their parts like they should. Overall I'm somewhat satisfied since it does work for what I needed it for, but for the shopper that wants to put items of value in here my ADVICE IS KEEP SHOPPING! Thank you and happy shopping.
customer_reviews.author: J B

customer_reviews.title: Locking plastic handle mechanism is a joke for a safe.
customer_reviews.text: It's true, the locking plastic handle is a joke. I think I could break it open with my bare hands. I can't imagine how a fire would not melt it (just the locking gray piece) but I'm not a plastics expert. Luckily I'm only using it for fire protection, and it will be sitting on the cement floor of my basement. If there was a chance it would get knocked over during a fire, I would have concerns about the lid popping open.
customer_reviews.author: Jeb Springfield

customer_reviews.title: Able to unlock without a key in 3 seconds flat, no security pins, returning
customer_reviews.text: If you want a safe to keep your items safe in a fire AND be hard for a burglar to get into, look somewhere else. I was able to get into this safe with just a pair of swiss army pliers, and rakeing the pins while applying a torque to the right. 3 seconds flat. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Viridianscarab

customer_reviews.title: This thing is heavy - you can tell the quality ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is heavy - you can tell the quality by its weight. I have no doubt it would hold up to a fire. I'm able to fit a ton of documents in it with room to spare. If you are wanting something to protect your valuables in case of fire this thing is it.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Consistency and Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The inside was warped and my hanging file folders did not fit in here, even though it's stated that they should... All the sides buldged in. I tried to contact support, I had to enter my number so they would call me and the system wouldn't take my 10 digit phone number "please enter at least 10 digits" which I did about 10 times trying different things. Returning because it's useless to me when its smaller than it should be due to buldging
customer_reviews.author: Tyson L. Goolsby

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This safe will withstand any elements. Key lock. Inside is much smaller than outside. Says it holds 40 hanging folders. Well, that is if they have only a few papers per file. This is my second box purchased in 25 years. The first was not as convincing against the elements as this one is. I am very happy with this purchase - and the price was terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Lid came completely off the safe
customer_reviews.text: The outer safe is made of plastic and the inner material seems to be some sort of white plaster of paris like material. There are no real "hinges" on the lid - and the plastic hinge quickly broke from the weight of the lid. I guess you get what you pay for. Buy a real safe made of metal with real hinges.
customer_reviews.author: Mike McClure

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a month
customer_reviews.text: I am very unhappy with this safe. After I had had it for about a month, the latch on the lid broke off of the safe. This happened when I was opening the safe when it was unlocked. The latch is made of flimsy plastic. It broke off in my hand. I was not using any force at all. It would be very easy to pry off with a screwdriver, if it had not broken off by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa G

customer_reviews.title: Lid just fell off - no need for a key!
customer_reviews.text: Got this in late 2017 - now past warranty but wanted you to know lid fell off! Pictures show the back top of safe where “safe” is splitting apart - it certainly isn’t a secure safe now. No need for a key ... lid just comes off. When it fell off - beige stuff went all over my floor - looks like saw dust!
customer_reviews.author: RightTime

customer_reviews.title: Falling Apart after 2 yrs.
customer_reviews.text: It is only 2 years old and it is falling apart. We only keep seldom used things inside so there is no excuse. Our older (other brand) safe is still going strong. The places that cracked started growing mold. Yuck. Buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: rhae

customer_reviews.title: Good for safekeeping your important documents, etc.
customer_reviews.text: Nice fireproof box for important documents etc. it’s heavy so be prepared to heft it where needed. I got this for my elderly mother but she couldn’t even lift it so I had to come over and move it to where she wanted it.
customer_reviews.author: LuuFamily

customer_reviews.title: Wow is all I can say
customer_reviews.text: For a safe I feel like the handle was cheaply made. I received this item very much damaged. Large cut down the side. It was obvious it had been opened somewhere else. The shipping box had no damage. It was filthy dirty. The handle to open is a cheap piece of plastic that will break pretty easily. I did get my refund back and returned it at no charge. That I was very pleased with. Went locally bought a safe made by the same company for $10 cheaper (rare I know) and made much more sturdy which is what you want with a safe.
customer_reviews.author: JOY

customer_reviews.title: Key arrived bent
customer_reviews.text: The safe is the perfect size for what I need to keep important papers safe in the event of a fire. However, one of the keys arrived bent. Also, the locking mechanism is heavy plastic, which seems to not be the most "secure" type of lock. Pretty sure I could pop it with a screwdriver if I really wanted to. So it should protect my papers from fire or flooding but won't do much to deter a thief.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Ann Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Good not great. Affordable maybe? Better to try a different product.
customer_reviews.text: This was the only decent and affordable fireproof safe I could find at the time and the reviews I read seem to be pretty accurate. It’s not that bad of a product but for sure the lock feels pretty wimpy and the corners / edges are stripping / falling apart slightly. Not sure how it’ll hold up in an actual fire. I have not owned it very long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: First the keys were in the safe to start with so my husband tried to figure out how to open it to get the key. so he got a screwdriver and all he had to do was push a little on the lock and it opened right up.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic locking mechanism
customer_reviews.text: It's heavy and may withstand fire and water for a while, but certainly not even a somewhat determined thief! The latch on this is a joke... Plastic? Really? On a security safe? I guess for the price I shouldn't be suprised. Be forewarned.
customer_reviews.author: ronandjenw

customer_reviews.title: Nice Paper Safe, Very Substantial
customer_reviews.text: Needed an additional safe box as I have accumulated too much for my other one to hold. This one is greatly different in looks but has a better fire protection than the old one. It's heavy, no doubt, but that was expected. The first one to arrive was damaged, the insulating material was all over the box and the unit. The fill plug for that on the bottom of the unit was broken open. Amazon had a new one here in 2 days. Great service. I don't want to have to try this one out, so will depend on its reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Gary H

customer_reviews.title: Bought new condition, received as used condition
customer_reviews.text: Spent $50 for a safe that looks like it had been used. Drywall dust or some kind of white powder all over it inside and out. Scratches on bottom. Easy enough to wipe down, too much of a hassle to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaholic

customer_reviews.title: ok as a fire safe NOT a Security safe.
customer_reviews.text: Just ok as a fire safe NOT a Security safe. Lock is a thin plastic joke, no point in locking it as a small child could break it. Good to keep files from burning and that's all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: took about 2 weeks doesnt come with any file separations like in the pictures
customer_reviews.text: it had the wrong key inside so had the hassel of getting another key that would fit to lock it , took about 2 weeks doesnt come with any file separations like in the pictures , very heavy
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Smashed and Unusable
customer_reviews.text: This unit is a blow molded plastic box, (like you would get with a cheap tool set) that is filled with plaster. It is shipped unprotected in a plain cardboard box, like Cardboard box touching the sides of the safe. When it arrived the box looked fine, no obvious damage, but when I opened the box the lid and face fell straight off. Plaster/Refractory dust was everywhere, hinges destroyed (I have trouble even calling the plastic nubs hinges, but...) This product would be a bad deal at $5. Why would you ship an inherently brittle fragile thing with no packaging? Save yourself the trouble returning it, and just don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice security... beware key rip-off!
customer_reviews.text: Security box is fine and as promised. I received 2 keys with the box; when I went to have copies made, I was told I would have to purchase them from Sentry. When I contacted Sentry, I was told they would charge me $30 for 2 keys; $50 for 4 keys. The locksmith would charge $30 for 6 keys. I had no options so yielded and bought the keys from Sentry. Ridiculous!!
customer_reviews.author: James M Broman

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price...maybe, but that plastic handle!  Hmmm...
customer_reviews.text: I saw the star ratings were good, was in a hurry and ordered it for my important folders. Then it came in and saw the plastic handle...or a fire resistant box??? Okay for now, but lesson learned in actually READING the reviews! But as mentioned in a hurry... I think 2 or 3 stars is more accurate...unless that handle is a stronger composite...but it doesn't appear so...
customer_reviews.author: D. Shearer

customer_reviews.title: BAD product don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with this purchase. Put my documents inside. One year later I open to find my documents have moisture and are wrinkled. To make things worse, as I'm emptying the papers, the lid breaks right off. I can't believe how cheaply this was made. How is it supposed to protect your valuables from water and fire if it gets moisture and cracks in half. Very annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Good place to protect important papers
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased to find that the file safe came to me in perfect condition. It comes with two straps that attach to the lid that let you store small things like passports, hard drives, etc. It takes standard size hanging file folders and you can also store standard size loose leaf binders in it too. I just ordered 50g silica drying pouches so that I can put one in the file safe to help keep the contents dry. I have no complaints and I recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: Grad-Student-To-Be

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed.
customer_reviews.text: I just needed a simple Fire-Waterproof safe for a few important documents. This does the trick. I had an issue being locked out of my safe and their customer service department stepped up to the plate. Pay attention to the dimensions so you know all of your documents and items will fit. This worked perfectly for me. I've had no issues with the plastic cracking or anything at all. It's a good purchase and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Wil W.

customer_reviews.title: bigger safe fire proof
customer_reviews.text: lits of space, recommend everyone gets this to keep all your important documents in just in case of fire or the act of God, you will still have the important info that you need to get back on your feet. i gave 4 star because one of the keys was bent , however that bent key can still unlock her :-) so no worries
customer_reviews.author: Ndun

customer_reviews.title: Hanging file feature is a great plus
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely not a safe but we bought it for the fireproof feature. I'm happy to report that we have not tested that feature but it is good to have that feeling of security!
customer_reviews.author: BAF

customer_reviews.title: I like the straps that hook to the inside of the ...
customer_reviews.text: We received this product today and it is everything we expected. Unfortunately one of the keys is bent and I cannot find a way to contact the manufacturer to send us a replacement key. The safe is heavy and durable with thick walls. The inside is the size I expected. I like the straps that hook to the inside of the top you can place folded papers or envelopes underneath. I hope to never have a fire or flood but it looks like it would hold up well. The walls are much thicker than my other one and the seal is tight. 3 stars because of bent key and anticipated hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa S

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Does everything it says. Works great. Weighs a ton but one strong person can pick it up and carry it up the stairs. Post master brought mine right to my door on the second floor. Six foot tall amazon lady. Now my mail is safe in my home as well as with her. Highly recommended. Amazon shipping was hassle free right to my door.
customer_reviews.author: PH03N1X

customer_reviews.title: This safe is not safe!
customer_reviews.text: I will avoid this safe at all cost. I've had it for 2 years and I assume that safes have longer life than that! I simply opened it up (there wasn't even an extra force or anything like that), and the heavy cover just broke and fell. As you can see in the pictures, it was almost like a cardboard ripping from its attachment. And I bought it to have my pictures safe from fire, and there isn't even a fire for this to break this bad! Total fail.
customer_reviews.author: Rez L.

product_meta.title: SentrySafe HD4100 Fireproof Safe and Waterproof Safe with Key Lock 0.65 Cubic Feet
product_meta.description: The SentrySafe HD4100 Fireproof Safe and Waterproof Safe holds up to 40 standard hanging folders making it the ideal storage solution for your important family or business documents. In-lid organization keeps frequently accessed items such as passports, check books and digital media within easy reach. Complete with ETL Verified flood protection and UL Classified fire protection to provide true peace of mind for your irreplaceable valuables.
feature_bullets: Fireproof box is UL Classified to endure 1/2 hour at 1550°F to protect irreplaceable documents, small valuables, DVDs, and USBs from fire
Waterproof box is ETL Verified for 72 hours of water submersion offering peace of mind in the event of a flood
Fire safe features a flat key lock to prevent the lid from opening in the event of a fire; includes two keys. Material - Captured Fire Insulation
Document safe features built-in straps for easy storage of passports, social security cards, and birth certificates; fire box accommodates letter-size hanging files and folders (sold separately)
Exterior: 15.5 in. W x 13.5 in. D x 14.3 in. H; Interior: 12 in. W x 8.1 in. H x 11.5 in. H; medium capacity 0.65 cubic feet; weighs 39 pounds

specifications.Included Components: Warranty, Sentrysafe Hd4100Cg Fire-Safe Waterproof File, Privacy Key Lock
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,072 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
